IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROMOTE, ENCOURAGE AND AID SCIENTIFIC INVESTIGATION, RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER AT KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY
IRS990.Desc: LICENSING AND COMMERCIALIZATION OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

ContractorCompensationGrp.ServicesDesc: SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORT FOR A L

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY VICE PRESIDENT FOR RESEARCH, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, AND CHIEF GOVERNMENTAL RELATIONS OFFICER SERVE AS EX-OFFICIO MEMBERS OF THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS. A MAJORITY OF ALL DIRECTORS MUST BE EMPLOYEES OF KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY. THE BOARD MAKES DECISIONS REGARDING ALL THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTS AND INSTRUMENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION, OVERSEES THE MANAGEMENT OF INVESTED FUNDS, AND ENSURES THAT KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION'S INVESTMENT POLICIES ARE FOLLOWED.

THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION IS KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY (KSU). KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION (KSURF) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING THE TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER ACTIVITIES OF KSU UNDER AN OPERATING AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE TWO ENTITIES. KSURF WORKS WITH KSU FACULTY TO IDENTIFY AND PROTECT RESEARCH DISCOVERIES AND TO COMMERCIALIZE THE TECHNOLOGY FOR THE BETTERMENT OF SOCIETY AND KSU, ITS FACULTY, STAFF, ALUMNI, AND STUDENTS. FURTHER, KSU CONTRACTS WITH KSURF TO SUPPORT ECONOMIC GROWTH STRATEGIC INITIATIVES BY MEANS OF CORPORATE ENGAGEMENT AND PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL AND REGIONAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ENTITIES.

TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER IS CLOSELY LINKED TO FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES IN UNIVERSITIES. UNDER THE BAYH-DOLE ACT OF 1980, UNIVERSITIES HAVE THE ABILITY TO RETAIN TITLE TO AND PROMOTE THE COMMERCIALIZATION OF INVENTIONS DEVELOPED UNDER GOVERNMENT FUNDING. WITH THIS ELECTION, UNIVERSITIES ARE REQUIRED TO PROPERLY MANAGE THE INVENTIONS INCLUDING REPORTING REQUIREMENTS, FILING PATENTS, MARKETING AND LICENSING THE INVENTION AND DISTRIBUTING RETURNS. THE REQUIREMENTS NECESSARY TO ADHERE TO THE BAYH-DOLE ACT ARE CONTRACTED TO KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION BY KSU. IF THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION DID NOT EXIST, KSU WOULD STILL BE REQUIRED TO CONFORM TO THESE REQUIREMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN REFLECTED IN THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. FOR EACH OF THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT RECOGNIZE ANY INTEREST OR PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH TAX MATTERS. THE FOUNDATION'S FEDERAL EXEMPT ORGANIZATION RETURNS (FORM 990) FOR 2023 AND 2022 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE IRS, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY ARE FILED. NO TAXING AUTHORITIES HAVE COMMENCED INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS.
PARTNERSHIP INCOME -158,485. S CORPORATION INCOME 132,530. ROUNDING 2.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORPORATION HAS ONE VOTING MEMBER WHICH IS KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE VOTING MEMBER IS KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY. MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT NEW BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE VOTING MEMBER'S APPROVAL IS REQUIRED TO 1)REMOVE A BOARD MEMBER, 2)REVOKE OR AMEND THE BYLAWS AND 3)REVOKE OR AMEND THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD RECEIVES A PRELIMINARY COPY FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF THE RETURN TO THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, DIRECTOR AND OFFICER ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE EMPLOYEE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE ON THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE ON THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY WEBSITE. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
